name: giving hat
sizes_available: baby (toddler, kid, adult small/medium, adult medium/large)
notes:
materials

- 1 (1, 1, 2, 2) ball(s) of purl soho’s [till][1], 100% andean highland wool yarn. each ball of this worsted- to chunky-weight yarn is 136 yards/ 100 grams; approximately 100 (115, 136, 165, 195) total yards required. we used the colors fresh grapefruit, lemongrass yellow, giant sequoia, wine berry, and green thicket.
- us 7 (4.5 mm), 12 or 16-inch [circular knitting needles][2], depending on size you are making or us 7, 32-inch circular needles for [magic loop][3]
- if using short circular needles: a set of us 7 [double pointed needles][4]
- [stitch markers][5], including one unique

gauge
17½ stitches and 25 rounds = 4 inches in stockinette stitch

sizes

for help choosing a hat size, check out our complete guide on [how to knit the right hat size][6]!

baby (toddler, kid, adult small/medium, adult medium/large)

to fit actual head circumference of 14–16 (16–18, 18–20, 20–22, 22–24) inches

- finished circumference: 13¾ (15½, 17½, 19¼, 21) inches
- finished height: 10 (10½, 11½, 12¼, 13¼) inches, uncuffed

sample: the fresh grapefruit hat is the baby size, the lemongrass yellow hat is the kid size, the giant sequoia and wine berry hats are the adult small/medium size, and the green thicket hat is the adult medium/large size.

pattern designed and written by purl soho designer, [gianna mueller][7]. see even more of gianna’s work [on her instagram][8]!
